title: Unity Among Brethren
shortSummary: Psalm 133 celebrates the beauty and blessing of unity among God's people. Using vivid imagery, David compares harmonious fellowship to precious anointing oil and refreshing dew, emphasizing that such unity invites God's eternal blessing. This brief psalm highlights the spiritual importance of living together in peace and concord.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The author of this psalm, King David, who expresses the joy and goodness of unity among brethren.

keyCharacters.name: Aaron
keyCharacters.description: The first high priest of Israel, referenced here to illustrate the sacred anointing oil that symbolizes blessing and consecration.

definitions.definition: A category of psalms sung by pilgrims ascending to Jerusalem, often associated with spiritual progress and worship.
A fragrant oil used for anointing priests and kings, symbolizing consecration, blessing, and the presence of the Holy Spirit.
A metaphor for refreshing and life-giving blessing, referring to the abundant dew on Mount Hermon, which nourishes the land.
The lower edges of Aaron’s priestly robes, indicating the extent to which the anointing oil flowed, symbolizing abundant blessing.

outline.heading: The Blessing of Unity
outline.description: David opens by declaring how good and pleasant it is for brethren to live together in unity, emphasizing the intrinsic value of harmonious relationships among God’s people.

outline.heading: Unity Compared to Anointing Oil
outline.description: The psalmist likens unity to the precious anointing oil poured on Aaron’s head, symbolizing holiness, consecration, and the overflowing blessing that unity brings.

outline.heading: Unity Compared to Dew on Zion
outline.description: Unity is further compared to the refreshing dew on Mount Hermon and Zion, illustrating how God’s blessing, including life forevermore, flows where there is unity.

application: Pursue unity with fellow believers as a reflection of God’s goodness and a source of spiritual blessing.
Recognize that unity among Christians is sacred, like the anointing oil, and should be protected and cherished.
Trust that God commands His blessing on communities that dwell together in peace, encouraging prayer for harmony in the church.
Allow the refreshing presence of God’s blessing to flow through your relationships by fostering peace and reconciliation.

keyVerses.text: Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity!
keyVerses.significance: This verse captures the central theme of the psalm, highlighting the intrinsic goodness and joy found in Christian unity.

keyVerses.text: It is like the precious ointment upon the head, that ran down upon the beard, even Aaron's beard: that went down to the skirts of his garments;
keyVerses.significance: This verse uses the sacred image of anointing oil on Aaron to illustrate the holiness and overflowing blessing that unity brings.

keyVerses.text: As the dew of Hermon, and as the dew that descended upon the mountains of Zion: for there the LORD commanded the blessing, even life for evermore.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes that God’s eternal blessing and life are granted where there is unity, symbolized by refreshing dew.
